keel.Algorithms.Decision_Trees.FunctionalTrees

Class TreeNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • keel.Algorithms.Decision_Trees.FunctionalTrees.TreeNode

  • public class TreeNode
extends java.lang.Object
    Data structure that is used in the construction of the decision tree. It stores the information about the relationship between nodes in a tree, and the type of node that it is along some other necessary information such as the attributes values, the attributes themselves or the output class for the item.
    Since:
    JDK1.5
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Written by Victoria Lopez Morales (University of Granada) 29/05/2009

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void assignOutputClass()
      Initializes the output class stored in the node with a valid output class, in a standard way, with the class stored in the node if it is pure or with the class of the majority of the instances where if there are two majority classes, it selects randomly one of them
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Checks if a tree node is the same tree node as another object
      int evaluate(double[] ind)
      Classifies a given item with the information stored in the node and its descendants, making a call to the specific classifiers at the leaves
      Split evaluateAllSplits(int splitCriteria)
      Evaluates all splits and returns the best split found.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> getClasses()
      Gets an array list with the different classes in the node
      Split getCondition()
      Gets the relationship between this node and its descendats, that's the way to split this node in two

      Gets the identifier of the node
      int getLeafs()
      Gets the number of leaf nodes from this node and its descendants

      Gets the left descendant of the node, if it is not a leaf node

      Searches a descendant node from this node with a specific id
      int[] getNodeError()
      Obtains the error of a leave node in a the tree from all the instances in the leaf in a two number array

      Gets the number of different classes in the node

      Gets the number of internal nodes from this node and its descendants.

      Gets the output class stored for the node.

      Gets the right descendant of the node, if it is not a leaf node
      int[] getTreeError()
      Obtains the general error of the tree from all its leaves in a two number array
      int hashCode()
      Hash-code function for the class that is used when object is inserted in a structure like a hashtable
      boolean isLeaf()
      Answers if the node is a leaf node or not
      boolean isPartitionable(int num_min_instances)
      Decides if a node is partitionable or not.
      java.lang.String printTree()
      Prints the tree in a String with all the information that makes it human readable
      void prune(double error)
      Prunes this leave or its descendants according to the error given, making it a leave with a classifier on it
      void pruneAllLeaves()
      Prunes all the leaves in the tree, this means, that all the leaves disappear and the ascendants of those leaves become the new leaves of the tree with the classifier at leaves
      void pruneWithError()
      Prunes the leaves in the tree that have greater error than the general error of the tree, making them leaves with classifiers on them

      Sets this node as a classifier leaf node.

      Sets this node as a leaf node.

      Replaces the relationship between this node and its descendants, this means, changing the condition how the two descendants are created.

      Replaces the output class of the node with another new output class

      Replaces the right descendant of the node with another new right descendant

      Splits a node into two nodes from a split following the identifier of a given number into an arraylist of nodes.

      Overriden function that converts the class to a string

        isLeaf - Logical value stating if a node is leaf or not

      • getOutputClass

        public int getOutputClass()
        Gets the output class stored for the node. It should be considered only when the node is a leaf node
        Returns:
        the output class of the node

      • setOutputClass

        public void setOutputClass(int outputClass)
        Replaces the output class of the node with another new output class
        Parameters:
        outputClass - New output class for the node

      • getCondition

        public Split getCondition()
        Gets the relationship between this node and its descendats, that's the way to split this node in two
        Returns:
        the split for this node

      • setCondition

        public void setCondition(Split condition)
        Replaces the relationship between this node and its descendants, this means, changing the condition how the two descendants are created. When using this function is highly recommended using the setLeft() and setRight() functions too
        Parameters:
        condition - New relationship between this node and its descendants

      • getNode

        public TreeNode getNode(int id)
        Searches a descendant node from this node with a specific id
        Parameters:
        id - Identifier of the node we are searching for
        Returns:
        the TreeNode with the specified id

      • getNumNodes

        public int getNumNodes()
        Gets the number of internal nodes from this node and its descendants. If this is a leaf node the number of internal nodes is 0.
        Returns:
        the number of internal nodes from this node and its descendants

      • getLeafs

        public int getLeafs()
        Gets the number of leaf nodes from this node and its descendants
        Returns:
        the number of leaf nodes from this node and its descendants

      • evaluate

        public int evaluate(double[] ind)
        Classifies a given item with the information stored in the node and its descendants, making a call to the specific classifiers at the leaves
        Parameters:
        ind - Data attribute values for the item we are classifying
        Returns:
        the class asigned to the item given

      • isPartitionable

        public boolean isPartitionable(int num_min_instances)
        Decides if a node is partitionable or not. A node is partitionable when the node is not pure or when the parent node at least has num_min_instances instances in it
        Parameters:
        num_min_instances - The minimum number of data instances that the tree node must contain to be considered a partitionable node
        Returns:
        true, if it is a partitionable node, false otherwise

      • setAsLeaf

        public void setAsLeaf()
        Sets this node as a leaf node. To set a node as leaf, we have to delete its descendants, mark the node as leaf, and assign a class for classification

      • setAsClassifierLeaf

        public void setAsClassifierLeaf()
        Sets this node as a classifier leaf node. To set a node as classifier leaf, we have to delete its descendants, mark the node as leaf, and assign an invalid class for classification

      • assignOutputClass

        public void assignOutputClass()
        Initializes the output class stored in the node with a valid output class, in a standard way, with the class stored in the node if it is pure or with the class of the majority of the instances where if there are two majority classes, it selects randomly one of them

      • getNumClasses

        public int getNumClasses()
        Gets the number of different classes in the node
        Returns:
        the number of different classes in the node

      • getClasses

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> getClasses()
        Gets an array list with the different classes in the node
        Returns:
        an array list with the different classes in the node

      • evaluateAllSplits

        public Split evaluateAllSplits(int splitCriteria)
        Evaluates all splits and returns the best split found. For each attribute, it evaluates all possible splits and select the split with the best split criteria
        Parameters:
        splitCriteria - Information measure used to compute the best split. 0 is the value for Entropy, 1 is for InformationGain, 2 is for GiniIndex and 3 is for GainRatio
        Returns:
        the best split for this node after evaluating all splits

      • valid_split

        public boolean valid_split(Split sp)
        Checks if a split is valid for a TreeNode, this means, that it will generate valid child nodes
        Parameters:
        sp - Split that is going to be checked if it generates valid child nodes
        Returns:
        true, if the split generates valid child nodes, false otherwise

      • split

        public java.util.ArrayList<TreeNode> split(Split sp,
                                           int newidentifier)
        Splits a node into two nodes from a split following the identifier of a given number into an arraylist of nodes.
        Parameters:
        sp - Split used in this node to divide the node into two new nodes left and right
        newidentifier - Identifier of the last node created in the algorithm
        Returns:
        an arraylist with two nodes, node left and node right obtained from the original node with the split

      • pruneAllLeaves

        public void pruneAllLeaves()
        Prunes all the leaves in the tree, this means, that all the leaves disappear and the ascendants of those leaves become the new leaves of the tree with the classifier at leaves

      • pruneWithError

        public void pruneWithError()
        Prunes the leaves in the tree that have greater error than the general error of the tree, making them leaves with classifiers on them

      • prune

        public void prune(double error)
        Prunes this leave or its descendants according to the error given, making it a leave with a classifier on it
        Parameters:
        error - General error of the tree that has to be surpassed in order to prune the leave

      • getTreeError

        public int[] getTreeError()
        Obtains the general error of the tree from all its leaves in a two number array
        Returns:
        an array with two numbers that summarizes the general error of the tree

      • getNodeError

        public int[] getNodeError()
        Obtains the error of a leave node in a the tree from all the instances in the leaf in a two number array
        Returns:
        an array with two numbers that summarizes the leaf error in the tree
